info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 02 at 3:31PM EST until March 03 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Rain changing to heavy wet snow possible. A narrow corridor of wet snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches is possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central and northeast Illinois and northwest Indiana. * WHEN...From late Friday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the afternoon and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible Friday afternoon within a narrow zone which would allow snow to accumulate on most road surfaces. Additionally, the heavy, wet nature of snow combined with the strong winds will lead to a potential for scattered power outages where the heaviest snow falls.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
